summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 23, 2019, detailing an incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt. The report includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, about the events leading up to the discovery, with Epstein later alleging that Tartaglione attempted to kill him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt. He later alleges his cellmate tried to kill him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck. Epstein later accuses him of attempted murder.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell (Z05-124LAD). Epstein accused Tartaglione of attempting to kill him and harassing him.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell lying on the floor, breathing heavily and snoring, with a red neck. He was placed on suicide watch after exhibiting unpredictable behavior.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein stated he came back from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 PM on the evening before the incident.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell in the early hours of July 23, 2019, after an apparent suicide attempt, with a red neck and marks consistent with a ligature.
Epstein later accused his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of attempting to kill him and harassing him, claiming he had informed his attorney of this matter.
Tartaglione's account was that he was asleep, felt something hit his legs, turned on the light, and saw Epstein with a string around his neck before calling the guards.
Epstein exhibited unpredictable behavior after being placed on suicide watch, including pretending to fall head-first off the bed when not directly observed.
Medical staff later examined Epstein and noted a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.
